problem_text:
For an automorphism φ ∈ Aut(G) of a group G, let [e]_φ = {g−1g^φ | g ∈ G}. Is it true that if a group G has trivial center, then there is an inner automorphism φ such that [e]_φ is not a subgroup?
V. G. Bardakov, M. V. Neshchadim, T. R. Nasybullov
answer: No, not always; see V. V. Bludov’s Example 2 in (D. Gon¸calves, T. Nasybullov, Commun. Algebra, 47, no. 3 (2019), 930–944).
